action.action-desc: Mr. Joyce of Ohio (for himself, Mr. Bost, and Ms. Slotkin) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Veterans' Affairs

form.official-title: To amend title 38, United States Code, to provide for the eligibility for educational assistance under the Department of Veterans Affairs Post-9/11 Educational Assistance Program of certain individuals who receive sole survivorship discharges, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Sgt. Wolf Kyle Weninger Veterans Education Fairness Act of 2022.

section.header: Eligibility for educational assistance under Department of Veterans Affairs Post-9/11 Educational Assistance Program of certain individuals who receive sole survivorship discharges

subsection.text: Subsection (b)(2) of section 3311 of title 38, United States Code, is amended—

paragraph.text: in the matter preceding subparagraph (A), by striking who;
by redesignating subparagraphs (A) and (B) as clauses (i) and (ii);
by inserting before clause (i), as so redesignated, the following new subparagraph (A):

subparagraph.text: by striking subparagraph (A) and inserting clause (i); and
by striking the period and inserting or by reason of a sole survivorship discharge (as that term is defined in section 1174(i) of title 10); or; and

paragraph.text: by adding at the end the following new subparagraph (B):

clause.text: commencing on or after September 11, 2001, completes at least 30 continuous days of service described in subsection (d) (1) or (2); and
after completion of service described in clause (i), is discharged or released by reason of a sole survivorship discharge (as that term is defined in section 1174(i) of title 10).

subsection.text: Subsection (d) of such section is amended by striking The following and inserting Except as provided in subsection (b)(2)(B), the following.
